alert.note: Alert for Adair; Audubon; Boone; Carroll; Cass; Dallas; Greene; Guthrie; Jasper; Madison; Marion; Marshall; Polk; Poweshiek; Story; Tama; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 2:41PM CDT until March 26 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Slushy and Slick Travel To Develop as Narrow Snow Band Moves Across Central Iowa Late Tonight into Sunday Morning... .A narrow band of snow will develop and move across central Iowa after midnight tonight through the Sunday morning hours. While the precipitation may start as rain in some portions of southern Iowa, a changeover to snow is expected. Snow rates will peak around 1 inch per hour and will be able to overcome warm pavement temperatures to allow for slushy and slick accumulations on roads, particularly untreated roads. While confidence is high in a snow band, there is lower confidence in the exact placement and the ultimate higher end totals. For now, will highlight 2 to 4 inches with localized higher amounts with accumulations highest on grassy areas. The snow will end from west to east through the morning hours with snow melting in the afternoon, though perhaps not completely in the areas that receive the most snow. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 1 PM CDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, though localized amounts greater than 4 inches possible. * WHERE...Parts of central Iowa. * WHEN...From 3 AM to 1 PM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slushy and slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
